main.name: Asset
main.description: The main Asset constructor. The object returned by `Assets.get()` is an instance of this.

children.name: mime
children.description: The mime type string as provided by the `Content-Type` header. Only available after the XHR Request has reached readyState 2.

children.name: done
children.description: Whether this asset is done loading. This includes errors, so an XHR Request that fails will result in `done` being `true`.

children.name: error
children.description: Whether this asset has encountered an error while loading.

children.name: loadedSize
children.description: The amount of data (in bytes) that has been downloaded. Updated on `progress` event.

children.name: totalSize
children.description: The total size of this asset. When the request reaches readyState 2, the size is retrieved from the `Content-Length` header, until the first `progress` event is fired: after that, `totalSize`is updated from the `progress` event object.

children.name: xhr
children.description: The XHR object used for this asset.

children.name: data
children.description: If you used `forceText` on `Assets.load()`, then `data` will be a string (equal to `XHR.responseText`). Otherwise, it will be an ArrayBuffer (equal to `XHR.response`).

children.name: blobURL
children.description: A URL pointing to the binary data (only available if you didn't use `forceText` on `Assets.load()`). You can use this as the value for a `src` attribute (on an image or `<audio` element, ffor example).
